qas.question: Where does E.University Blvd. lead to?
What mode of transport is encouraged in Central Tuscon?
Of the 3.5 miles from N. Mountain Avenue to Rillito River Park, how many are bike-only?
Which Tucson street is devoted to bicycles?
How long does N Mountain Ave have a bike lane?

answers.text: half of the 3.5 miles (5.6 km) to the Rillito River Park

qas.question: Which park has a multi-use path?
Which bike path does Highland lead to?
Which shopping area is on East University?

context: Central Tucson is <a2_0>bicycle<a2_0/>-friendly. To the east of the University of Arizona, <a4_0>Third Street<a4_0/> is bike-only except for local traffic and passes by the historic homes of the <a1_0>Sam Hughes neighborhood<a1_0/>. To the west, E. University Boulevard leads to the <a0_0><a8_0>Fourth Avenue Shopping District<a8_0/><a0_0/>. To the North, N. Mountain Avenue has a full bike-only lane for <a3_0><a5_0>half<a3_0/> of the 3.5 miles (5.6 km) to the <a6_0>Rillito River Park<a6_0/><a5_0/> bike and walk multi-use path. To the south, N. Highland Avenue leads to the <a7_0>Barraza-Aviation Parkway<a7_0/> bicycle path.
